content.match_overview: This crucial Premier League clash sees 7th-place Brighton (12-11-6) host 9th-place Aston Villa (12-9-8) at the Amex Stadium, with just three points separating these European hopefuls. Brighton comes off an FA Cup penalty shootout heartbreak against Nottingham Forest [4], while Villa rides a six-game winning streak across all competitions [5]. Both teams average over 2.6 goals per game this season, with 64% of their H2H meetings seeing BTTS [7].

my_say.content: Under the Amex lights, this clash of contrasting philosophies sees Brighton's possession-based idealism (85% pass accuracy [1]) collide with Villa's transition mastery. While the Seagulls' 30 assists [1] showcase their intricate build-up, Villa's 20 goals in 10 games [3] reveal ruthless efficiency. All eyes on Watkins - the striker has transformed from £28m gamble to £80m asset through relentless movement. Yet Brighton's teenage sensation Minteh (18), starting his first major clash, could be the wildcard. With Champions League dreams hanging in the balance, this isn't just a match - it's a £50m playoff played three months early. Expect fireworks as these ambitious projects collide in a game where every tactical tweak could mean continental football or bitter disappointment.
